alert.note: Alert for Cortland (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Binghamton (South Central New York and Northeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 18 at 10:38AM EST until December 20 at 7:00PM EST by NWS Binghamton
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in New York... Tioughnioga River At Cortland affecting Cortland County. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON TO WEDNESDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Tioughnioga River at Cortland. * WHEN...From this afternoon to Wednesday evening. * IMPACTS...At 10.0 feet, Moderate flood stage. Some flooding begins to affect roads and basements in the Village of Marathon and the Yaman Park area of Cortland. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:00 AM EST Monday the stage was 6.9 feet. - Bankfull stage is 8.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late this afternoon to a crest of 9.1 feet tomorrow morning. It will then fall below flood stage Wednesday morning. - Flood stage is 8.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening at 1045 PM EST.
